instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message:
Hi -
I have a 820-4924 that had light liquid damage near SMC and U7001 but not really much. The board was missing PPBUS, but has been restored. This board will only power on if a battery is connected. Here are the measurements from AC adapter. Green/Amber light present. 85 Watt Original. Thanks.

PPBUS - 12.58V
PP3v42 - 3.428V
PPVRTC - 3.336V
PPVIN_S5_HS_Computing - 12.58V
PP18vDCIN - 16.6V
PP5V_S5 - 5.02V
PP5V_S3 - 0V
PP3v3_s5 - 3.35V
pp3v3_3 - 0V

Have a good one.

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Crap under SMC likely. Is it actually charging the battery?

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Hey Duke. Reflowed then replaced SMC. It still powers on with battery or battery and charger. Will not power on with charger only. Yes it charges the battery. If I want to power on with only charger I have to use a chinese charger. Weird. Other then that it works totally normal. Have green/Amber on both chargers. Thank you sir.

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: That would be a Q7180 or Q7010 problem. Not saying the actual FETs are bad it could also be resistors/traces to them.

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Just wondering... What allows it to work with a Chinese charger and not allow original charger? Chinese charger works.

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: They do not have over current protection. Issue is in the components I mentioned.

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message:
Thanks for that...
I have looked into the areas you suggested with no luck so far. I have checked traces, checked resistors in the area and replaced both Q7180 and Q7010. With original charger I am getting pulses of 16.60 - 16.80V on the DC-in connector. With the Chinese one I get a steady 16.5V in the same test location. Powers on automatically when magsafe is plugged in with a battery attached.  What can I be missing?

Have a good one.

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Measure voltages to both gates of Q7180 with the Chinese charger. Checked resistance between pins 17/18, 27/28 of U7100?

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message:
Hi Duke.

6.11v - 6.25v on S_Gate
6.21v - 6.29v on A_Gate


R7122 and R7121 were off. I replaced them as well as C7120 -23. It did turn on once with original charger after replacing the resistors, but hasnt since. Reistance on 17/18 - 3.8Ohm, 27/28 - 20.3Ohms. I replaced U7100 and Q7180 again, just to be safe.

Thanks man.

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: It could be something on PPBUS that is loading down the charger too much. Can you monitor current on a PSU and compare to a good board?

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message:
Hey Duke. With original charger tip on PSU?

Thank you.

threads.title: 820-4924 Only Powers from Battery
threads.message: Doesn't matter, the current protection is in the brick not the lead.
